name: Candor
headline: We help companies win government funding with AI
description:
Candor helps defense, energy, and biotech startups win tens of billions of dollars in US government funding. Our AI software auto-drafts proposals and ensures full compliance.

When we met at Stanford 4 years ago, it was rare for startups to work with the US Government. In the years that we’ve been involved in the burgeoning Defense Tech ecosystem, a lot has changed. Silicon Valley and the US Government are closer than they’ve been in decades.  

As fellows in Stanford’s Center for National Security Innovation, we’ve had the privilege of speaking with dozens of government officials who have come to Silicon Valley looking to fund and scale startups solving their most urgent problems. 

However, we’ve seen firsthand the struggles these startups face in securing gov funding. Marcus, having spoken with dozens of defense startups in his time helping lead the Stanford Defense Tech Club and trying to set up a national security startup accelerator has seen this especially.

That’s why we’re making it easier to find and apply for opportunities, taking the application process from weeks to days.

We’re only going to see more cooperation in the coming years. With that, there will be increasingly more funding going towards companies in defense, energy, biotech, quantum, etc. Candor lets you unlock that funding potential.

founders.name: Ethne Laude, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and CTO at Candor. Previously interned as a quant trader at Morgan Stanley building low-latency trading systems and as a research scholar at the Space Force. Studied CS systems and Math at Stanford, researching compiling sparse tensor applications to domain-specific hardware. Worked on building a DoD PEO Directory as a National Security Innovation Scholar.

founders.name: Marcus Zimmerman, Founder
founders.description: CEO of Candor. Prev & Stanford. Helped run Stanford's DEFCON Technology and National Security Network. Worked on a Defense incubator as a National Security Innovation Fellow. Product/Growth at an ex-YC Startup. Angel Investor in various startups, particularly Defense & GovTech

## Discover Opportunities with AI-Enabled Search Engine
Recommendations delivered right to your inbox
  * Get notified anytime a relevant SBIR solicitation releases
  * Never search through SAM.gov, Grants.gov, or DSIP ever again


## AI Co-pilot for Drafting and Editing
No more starting from scratch. Generate 80% of your proposal in one click, using your own company's data and templates
  * Fill in the spine of your proposal and generate
  * Superintelligence. Our AI Assistant has access to government, company, and web data

## Red Team Review Proposals for Compliance
See what aspects of your proposal are missing the mark

## Isolated and Secure Data Storage
AI tools that use past proposals to make the next ones much faster. Never have to worry about putting your company's data in ChatGPT ever again
  * Security first. Your data stays proprietary and siloed, not used to train models
  * Higher quality responses that use your data for context

generated_description:
### Candor: Revolutionizing Government Funding for Startups with AI

**Overview**
Candor is a promising startup founded in 2025 and hailing from San Francisco. It’s part of the Y Combinator Batch W25 and is on a mission to assist companies in winning government funding using artificial intelligence. Specifically, Candor focuses on defense, energy, and biotech startups, helping them unlock the vast potential of U.S. government funding, which can amount to tens of billions of dollars.

**The Proposition**
The landscape of government contracting, especially for startups, has transformed significantly in recent years. As the gap between Silicon Valley and the U.S. Government narrows, opportunities for collaboration have surged. Having been at the forefront of this movement, the Candor team—comprised of just two employees—aims to streamline the formerly burdensome application process. What once took weeks can now be accomplished in only a few days, thanks to their sophisticated AI tools.

**What They Do**
Candor's AI-driven platform offers a suite of functionalities that drastically reduce the time and effort required to draft and submit funding proposals. 

1. **AI Co-pilot**: It assists startups in generating up to 80% of their proposals in one click by utilizing existing company data and templates.
   
2. **Opportunity Detection**: Their AI search engine delivers tailored notifications on relevant funding opportunities, sparing entrepreneurs the hassle of navigating government databases.

3. **Proposal Compliance**: Candor uses advanced algorithms to ensure submissions meet compliance standards, preventing startups from losing out on funding due to technicalities.

4. **Secure Data Handling**: The platform prioritizes security by keeping client data siloed and proprietary, ensuring sensitive information remains confidential.

**Background and Insights**
Founded by individuals who witnessed firsthand the challenges defense startups faced in securing government funding, Candor's team has a unique perspective. Their interactions with government officials as part of Stanford's Center for National Security Innovation illuminate a path forward for those looking to innovate in defense tech and other sectors.

With growing cooperation likely between the tech sector and governmental agencies, companies that can adapt to the funding ecosystem will benefit significantly. Candor positions itself as a crucial partner in this evolving landscape.

**Conclusion**
As government funding becomes increasingly vital for startup success in defense, energy, and biotech, Candor stands ready to bolster entrepreneurs through its innovative AI solutions. If you're looking to accelerate your journey toward securing that precious government funding, visit [Candor's website](https://www.usecandor.ai) and see how their tools can transform your strategy.
